dta.RoadLink¶

class dta.RoadLink(id, startNode, endNode, reverseAttachedLinkId, facilityType, length, freeflowSpeed, effectiveLengthFactor, responseTimeFactor, numLanes, roundAbout, level, label)¶

Bases: dta.Link.Link

A RoadLink in a network. Both nodes must be RoadNodes.

__init__(id, startNode, endNode, reverseAttachedLinkId, facilityType, length, freeflowSpeed, effectiveLengthFactor, responseTimeFactor, numLanes, roundAbout, level, label)¶

Constructor.

  • id is a unique identifier (unique within the containing network), an integer
  • startNode, endNode are Nodes
  • reverseAttachedId is the id of the reverse link, if attached; pass None if not attached
  • facilityType is a non-negative integer indicating the category of facility such as a freeway, arterial, collector, etc. A lower number indicates a facility of higher priority, that is, higher capacity and speed.
  • length is the link length. Pass None to automatically calculate it.
  • freeflowSpeed is in km/h or mi/h
  • effectiveLengthFactor is applied to the effective length of a vehicle while it is on the link. May vary over time with LinkEvents
  • responseTimeFactor is the applied to the response time of the vehicle while it is on the link. May vary over time with LinkEvents
  • numLanes is an integer
  • roundAbout is true/false or 1/0
  • level is an indicator to attribute vertical alignment/elevation. If None passed, will use default.
  • label is a link label. If None passed, will use default.

Methods

__init__ x.__init__(...) initializes x; see help(type(x)) for signature
RoadLink.addLanePermission
RoadLink.euclideanLength
DEFAULT_LEVEL¶

default level value

addLanePermission(laneId, vehicleClassGroup)¶

Adds the lane permissions for the lane numbered by laneId (outside lane is lane 0, increases towards inside edge.)

addOutgoingMovement(movement)¶

Adds the given movement.

addShapePoint(sequenceNum, x, y)¶

Adds a shape point to the link for the given sequenceNum

addShifts(startShift, endShift)¶
  • startShift: the shift value of the first segment of the link, that is, the number of lanes from the center line of the roadway that the first segment is shifted.
  • endShift: End-shift: the shift value of the last segment of the link, that is, the number of lanes from the center line of the roadway that the last segment is shifted.
euclideanLength()¶

Calculates the length based on simple Euclidean distance.

getCenterLine()¶

Offset the link to the right 0.5*numLanes*lane_width and return a tuple of two points representing the centerline.

getEndNode()¶

Accessor for endNode

getId()¶

Return the link id

getLength()¶

Return the length of the link

getNumIncomingMovements()¶

Returns the number of incoming movements

getNumLanes()¶

Return the number of lanes.

getNumOutgoingMovements()¶

Returns the number of outgoing movements

getOtherEnd(node)¶

Return the other end node than the one provided.

getOutgoingMovement(nodeId)¶

Return True if the link has an outgoing movement towards nodeId

getReferenceAngle()¶

Visualizing the link as a straight vector from (0,0), returns the angle between <1,0> and this link.

So returns a number in [0,2pi), increasing clockwise.

These are based on the euclidean length of the link, so assumes a straight line. If the link has no length, returns 0.

getShifts()¶

Returns the startShift and endShift ordered pair, or (None,None) if it wasn’t set. See addShifts() for details.

getStartNode()¶

Accessor for startNode

hasOutgoingMovement(nodeId)¶

Return True if the link has an outgoing movement towards nodeId

isConnector()¶

Return True if this Link is a Connector

isRoadLink()¶

Return True this Link is RoadLink

isVirtualLink()¶

Return True if this LInk is a VirtualLink

iterIncomingMovements()¶

Iterator for the incoming movements of this link

iterOutgoingMovements()¶

Iterator for the outgoing movements of this link

removeOutgoingMovement(movementToRemove)¶

Delete the input movement

setNumLanes(numLanes)¶

Sets the number of lanes to the given value
